   42: 
   43: 	% if this fails, focus on environment_SUITE to fix test setup.
   44:     crypto:start(),
   45:     application:start(emysql),
   46:     emysql:add_pool(test_pool, 1,
   47:         test_helper:test_u(), test_helper:test_p(), "localhost", 3306,
   48:         "hello_database", utf8),
   49:     Config.
   50:     
   51: % clean up
   52: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
   53: end_per_suite(_) ->
   54: 	ok.

   56: init_per_testcase(dying_client_does_not_lock_the_connection_out, Config) ->
   57:     LockTimeout = emysql_app:lock_timeout(),
   58:     DefaultTimeout = emysql_app:default_timeout(),
   59:     application:set_env(emysql, lock_timeout, 15000),
   60:     application:set_env(emysql, default_timeout, 15000),
   61:     [{old_sysconfig, [{lock_timeout, LockTimeout}, {default_timeout, DefaultTimeout}]} | Config];
   62: init_per_testcase(_, Config) ->
   63:     Config.
   64: 
   65: end_per_testcase(dying_client_does_not_lock_the_connection_out, Config) ->
   66:     [ application:set_env(emysql, K, V) || {K, V} <- proplists:get_value(old_sysconfig, Config) ],
   67:     Config;
   68: end_per_testcase(_, Config) ->
   69:     Config.

   71: %% Test Case: Test two processes trying to share one connection
   72: %% Test for Issue 9
   73: %% Original name: two_procs(_)
   74: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
   75: stuck_waiting_1(_) ->
   76:     Num = 2,
   77:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
   78:     [spawn_link(fun test_proc/0)
   79:      || _ <- lists:seq(1,Num)],
   80:     [receive
   81: 	 {'EXIT', _, Reason} -> 
   82: 	     normal = Reason
   83:      end
   84:      || _ <- lists:seq(1,Num)],
   85:     ok.
   86: 
   87: %% Process that will do a bunch of requests against mysql
   88: test_proc() ->
   89:     [
   90:      #result_packet{} = emysql:execute(test_pool, "describe hello_table;")
   91:      || _ <- lists:seq(1,1000)
   92:     ].
   93:      
   94: %% Test Case: Make sure that the pool is still usable after a lock timeout
   95: %% Test for race on connection where the connection is sent to a process
   96: %% at the exact same time it hits the timeout.
   97: %% See ransomr's first comment on Issue 9
   98: %% Original name: no_lock_timeout(_)
   99: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  100: pool_leak_1(_) ->
  101:     Num = 2,
  102:     OldEnv = application:get_env(emysql, lock_timeout),
  103:     %% This is really hard to repro - the timing is very tricky.
  104:     %% On my machine a timeout of 1 seems to reproduce it after about 10 attempts.
  105:     %% Once it happens the connection is lost from the pool, so the pool needs to be reset.
  106:     application:set_env(emysql, lock_timeout, 1),
  107:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  108:     [spawn_link(fun test_proc/0)
  109:      || _ <- lists:seq(1,Num)],
  110:     %% We expect one process to timeout, but the other should exit normally
  111:     receive
  112: 	{'EXIT', _, Reason1} ->
  113: 	    connection_lock_timeout = Reason1
  114:     end,
  115:     receive
  116: 	{'EXIT', _, Reason2} ->
  117: 	    normal = Reason2
  118:     end,
  119: 
  120:     case OldEnv of
  121: 	undefined ->
  122: 	    application:unset_env(emysql, lock_timeout);
  123: 	{ok, Timeout} ->
  124: 	    application:set_env(emysql, lock_timeout, Timeout)
  125:     end,
  126:     ok.
  127:     
  128: %% Test Case: Test two processes trying to share one connection.
  129: %% Test for race Issue #9.
  130: %% If one process times out, then it got stuck likely by the first of
  131: %% the races described by Ransom in Issue #9.
  132: %% This is a mod of Ransom's original two_proc test that replicates
  133: %% the race more consistently on some machines. /hd
  134: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  135: stuck_waiting_2(_) ->
  136:     
  137:     % parellel processes, fast loops of sql command, timout factor vs need. 
  138:     Processes = 2,
  139:     Loops = 10000,
  140:     LenienceFactor = Loops * 2,
  141: 
  142:     % find needed time for the sql command
  143:     {Micro, _} = timer:tc(?MODULE, ?TRY_RACE, [1]),
  144:     Timeout = trunc(Micro / 1000 * LenienceFactor) + 100,
  145:     ct:log("Seen execution time: ~p ï¿½s (microseconds)~n", [Micro]),
  146:     ct:log("Set timeout: ~p ms (milliseconds)~n", [Timeout]),
  147: 
  148:     %% Warn about time when run with actual MySQL query for TRY_RACE.
  149:     Timeout > 5000 andalso
  150:         ct:print("This race test will take approx. ~p seconds.~n", [round(Timeout/1000)]),
  151:     
  152:     % set timeout
  153:     OldEnv = application:get_env(emysql, lock_timeout),
  154:     application:set_env(emysql, lock_timeout, Timeout),
  155:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  156: 
  157:     [spawn_link(conn_mgr_SUITE, ?TRY_RACE, [Loops])
  158:      || _ <- lists:seq(1,Processes)],
  159:     [receive
  160: 	 {'EXIT', _, normal} -> 
  161: 	    ct:log("One process complete, other could now use connections.", []);
  162: 	 {'EXIT', _, connection_lock_timeout} -> 
  163: 	    ct:log("One process exits stuck in timeout.", []),
  164: 	    ct:log("Timout was set to ~pms to be sure it can even outlast complete starvation by the other process and really indicatetes that even a free connection could be assigned to this process. Loops: ~p, used time for one sample SQL operation: ~p ms.", 
  165: 	    [Timeout, Loops, Micro/1000]),
  166: 	    exit(issue9_stuck_waiting);
  167: 	 {'EXIT', _, Reason} -> exit({unexpected_error, Reason})
  168:      end
  169:      || _ <- lists:seq(1,Processes)],
  170: 
  171:     case OldEnv of
  172: 	undefined ->
  173: 	    application:unset_env(emysql, lock_timeout);
  174: 	{ok, Timeout} ->
  175: 	    application:set_env(emysql, lock_timeout, Timeout)
  176:     end,
  177:     ok.
  178:  
  179:      
  180: %% Test Case: Make sure that no connections are lost from the pool.
  181: %% Test for race Issue #9.
  182: %% Test for race on connection where the connection is sent to a 
  183: %% process at the exact same time it hits the timeout.
  184: %% This is a mod of Ransom's original pool_leak_1 test that 
  185: %% replicates the race more consistently on some machines. /hd
  186: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  187: pool_leak_2(_) ->
  188:     Processes = 100,
  189:     Loops = 10,
  190:     EmptyGb = gb_trees:empty(),
  191:     
  192:     %% find this output via test/index.html
  193:     [Pool] = emysql_conn_mgr:pools(),
  194:     ct:log("Pool available at start: ~p~n", [Pool#pool.available]),
  195: 
  196:     %% preliminary test
  197:     [#emysql_connection{pool_id     = test_pool,
  198:                         prepared    = EmptyGb,
  199:                         locked_at   = undefined,
  200:                         alive       = true,
  201:                         test_period = 0}] = queue:to_list(Pool#pool.available),
  202: 
  203:     %% Brief timeout for test
  204:     OldEnv = application:get_env(emysql, lock_timeout),
  205:     application:set_env(emysql, lock_timeout, 1),
  206: 
  207:     %% Make 100 processes grap and release connections in parallel
  208:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  209:     [spawn_link(?MODULE, lock_and_pass_connection, [Loops]) 
  210:         % Don't use ?TRY_RACE here, it races too rarely.
  211:      || _ <- lists:seq(1,Processes)],
  212:     [receive _ -> ok end 
  213:      || _ <- lists:seq(1,Processes)],
  214: 
  215:     %% Test if pool still has one connection (and available)
  216:     [Pool1] = emysql_conn_mgr:pools(),
  217:     ct:log("Pool available after test: ~p~n", [Pool1#pool.available]),
  218:     case queue:to_list(Pool1#pool.available) of
  219:         [#emysql_connection{pool_id     = test_pool,
  220:                             prepared    = EmptyGb,
  221:                             locked_at   = undefined,
  222:                             alive       = true,
  223:                             test_period = 0}] -> ok;
  224:         [] -> exit(issue9_pool_leak);
  225:         E -> exit({unexpected_error, E})
  226:     end,
  227:     
  228:     %% Refit default timout for other tests -- TODO: fix for all tests.
  229:     case OldEnv of
  230: 	undefined ->
  231: 	    application:unset_env(emysql, lock_timeout);
  232: 	{ok, Timeout} ->
  233: 	    application:set_env(emysql, lock_timeout, Timeout)
  234:     end,
  235:     ok.
  236: 
  237: %% TRY_RACE: process that gets and releases a connection in fastest succession.
  238: %% Substitute for make_queries/1, executing and also provoking races faster.
  239: lock_and_pass_connection(Loops) ->
  240:     [   case emysql_conn_mgr:wait_for_connection(test_pool) of
  241: 	        Connection ->
  242:         	        emysql_conn_mgr:pass_connection(Connection)
  243:         end
  244:         || _ <- lists:seq(1,Loops)
  245:     ].
  246: 
  247: %% Alternate payload of TRY_RACE. Less canceled down stand-in for above.
  248: %% Process that will do a bunch of requests against mysql
  249: make_queries(Loops) ->
  250:     [ #result_packet{} = emysql:execute(test_pool, "describe hello_table")
  251:      || _ <- lists:seq(1,Loops)
  252:     ].
  253: 
  254: %% Test Case: Make sure that the pool is still usable after a waiting client dies
  255: dying_client_does_not_lock_the_connection_out(_Config) ->
  256:     #result_packet{} = emysql:execute(test_pool, "select 1"),
  257:     F1 = fun() -> emysql:execute(test_pool, "select sleep(5);", 15000) end,
  258:     Client = spawn(F1),
  259:     timer:sleep(1000),
  260: 
  261:     exit(Client, kill),
  262:     timer:sleep(1000),
  263:     #result_packet{} = emysql:execute(test_pool, "select 1").
